sn47.19:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sumbhas, near the town of the Sumbhas named Sedaka.
sn47.19:1.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn47.19:1.3: “Once upon a time, mendicants, a pole acrobat of the corpse-workers set up the bamboo pole of his tribe and said to his apprentice Medakathālikā,
sn47.19:1.4: ‘Come now, dear Medakathālikā, climb up the bamboo pole and stand on my shoulders.’
sn47.19:1.5: ‘Yes, tutor,’ she replied. She climbed up the bamboo pole and stood on her tutor’s shoulders.
sn47.19:1.6: Then the pole acrobat of the corpse-workers said to Medakathālikā,
sn47.19:1.7: ‘You look after me, dear Medakathālikā, and I’ll look after you.
sn47.19:1.8: That’s how, guarding and looking after each other, we’ll display our skill, collect our fee, and get down safely from the bamboo pole.’
sn47.19:1.9: When he said this, Medakathālikā said to her teacher,
sn47.19:1.11: You should look after yourself, and I’ll look after myself.
sn47.19:1.12: That’s how, guarding and looking after ourselves, we’ll display our skill, collect our fee, and get down safely from the bamboo pole.’
sn47.19:2.1: That’s the way,” said the Buddha. “It’s just as Medakathālikā said to her tutor.
sn47.19:2.2: Thinking ‘I’ll look after myself,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.
sn47.19:2.3: Thinking ‘I’ll look after others,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.
sn47.19:2.4: Looking after yourself, you look after others; and looking after others, you look after yourself.
sn47.19:3.1: And how do you look after others by looking after yourself?
sn47.19:3.2: By development, cultivation, and practice of meditation.
sn47.19:3.4: And how do you look after yourself by looking after others?
sn47.19:3.5: By acceptance, harmlessness, love, and sympathy.
sn47.19:3.7: Thinking ‘I’ll look after myself,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.
sn47.19:3.8: Thinking ‘I’ll look after others,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.
sn47.19:3.9: Looking after yourself, you look after others; and looking after others, you look after yourself.”
